Key Arguments: The legislation is an attack on freedom of speech, a fundamental right.
The government cannot objectively determine what is true or false.
The law could cause harm by censoring potentially truthful information, as illustrated by the COVID-19 lab leak theory.
The government seeks to exempt itself from the law, which is hypocritical.
The legislation could lead to biased censorship and threaten democracy.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech is a fundamental right of every Australian.
No government body has the wisdom or ability to sort out what is true and what isn't.
The bill is misguided and must be rejected.
